page.title: 05MANSION HOUSES
page.content: This is the oldest of three mansion houses in the Parish of Resolis. The original house here was called Ardoch, but in 1757, the laird married a rich heiress called Jemima Poyntz, and rebuilt his house in the Dutch style, naming it Poyntzfield in her honour. This building has been added to over the years, making it more interesting with the different styles of architecture. Its most interesting feature is the tower, at the top of which is a secret room. From here there are magnificent views over the surrounding countryside. Another point of interest is the unusual drawing room door which is curved. It is solid mahogany, and was carved by the local joiner's grandfather. The house is now a hotel and is becoming very popular with local people and tourists alike.
